title: Stam quits as Feyenoord manager after Ajax mauling
text:
Soccer Football - Europa League - Group G - BSC Young Boys v Feyenoord - Stade de Suisse, Bern, Switzerland - October 24, 2019 Jaap Stam before the match REUTERS/Denis Balibouse

(Reuters) - Jaap Stam has stepped down from his role as Feyenoord manager after less than five months in charge, the Dutch top-flight club has said.

Under former Manchester United defender Stam, who took over from Giovanni van Bronckhorst in June, Feyenoord have won just three of their 11 league games this season, leaving the Rotterdam club in 12th place.

The 47-year-old’s last match in charge was a 4-0 defeat at Ajax Amsterdam on Sunday.

"It certainly has not been an easy decision," Stam said in a statement on the club's website here "I have thought about it long and hard. My ultimate conclusion is that it is better for the club, the players and myself if I step aside."

Stam was previously manager of English club Reading, who he led to the second-tier Championship playoffs in his first season in charge.

He joined Feyenoord, who are also bottom of their Europa League group, from Dutch side PEC Zwolle.
description: Jaap Stam has stepped down from his role as Feyenoord manager after less than five months in charge, the Dutch top-flight club has said.
